Class Player

  • java.lang.Object

  • public class Player
extends java.lang.Object
    Player class for wrapping the data associated with player entity

    • Method Detail

      • pickDedicationToken

        public boolean pickDedicationToken(java.lang.String move,
                          LanternCards returnedLanternCards,
                          LanternCards globalLanternCards,
                          DedicationTokens dedicationToken)
        This method will be called when the user is exchanging lantern cards for a dedication token
        Parameters:
        move - The move that has been made by the player(three pair, four of a king, seven unique)
        dedicationToken - The object containing the current stack of dedication tokens on the table
        lanternCards - The lantern cards to return

      • pickFavorTokens

        public void pickFavorTokens(FavorTokens favorToken)
        This method will be called when the lake tile contains a platform in it
        Parameters:
        favorToken - - The object containing the current stack of favor tokens available.

      • getLakeTiles

        public java.util.ArrayList<LakeTiles> getLakeTiles()
        This method will be called to store lake tiles of the player return PlayerLTStack

      • placeLakeTile

        public LakeTiles placeLakeTile(int index)
        This method will be called when the player places his/her lake tile on the board
        Parameters:
        index - - identifies which lake tile the user is placing on the board.
        Returns:
        return the lake tile the player wants to place on the board.

      • spendFavorTokens

        public boolean spendFavorTokens(FavorTokens favorToken,
                       LanternCards lanternCards,
                       java.lang.String returnLCard,
                       java.lang.String pickLCard)
        This method will be called when the user spend token to exchange the lantern card
        Parameters:
        favorToken - The object containing the current stack of favor tokens on the table
        lanternCards - The object contains the current stack of Lantern Cards
        returnLCard - The lantern card return by user
        pickLCard - The lantern card pick by user
        Returns:
        either true or false based on current favor token score of the player

      • returnLanternCards

        public boolean returnLanternCards(java.lang.String returnLCard,
                         java.lang.String pickLCard,
                         LanternCards lanternCardsAvailable)
        This method will be called from spendFavorTokens method to exchange lantern cards between player stack and general stack
        Parameters:
        returnLCard - The lantern card return by user
        pickLCard - The lantern card pick by user
        lanternCardsAvailable - The object contains the current stack of Lantern Cards
        Returns:
        either true or false based on the availability of chosen lantern cards in the common stack

      • pickLanternCard

        public boolean pickLanternCard(java.lang.String card,
                      LanternCards lanternCardsAvailable)
        This method will be called once the user has placed a lake tile
        Parameters:
        card - contains what color of the lantern card the user will be adding to his stack.
        Returns:
        either true or false based on the availability of lantern cards in the common stack

        public java.util.ArrayList<Player> assignBoardPosition(int numOfPlayers,
                                              java.util.ArrayList<Player> playersList,
                                              LakeTiles startTile)
        This method will be called to assign location to Players with respect to Game Board
        Parameters:
        numOfPlayers - Number of Players
        playersList - Arraylist containing all players
        startTile - Start LakeTile on Board
        Returns:
        Arraylist containing all players

      • turnToStartGame

        public java.util.ArrayList<Player> turnToStartGame(int numOfPlayers,
                                          java.util.ArrayList<Player> playersList,
                                          LakeTiles startTile)
        This method will be called to assign location to Players with respect to Game Board
        Parameters:
        numOfPlayers - Number of Players
        playersList - Arraylist containing all players
        startTile - Start LakeTile on Board
        Returns:
        String containing player's name who will start the game
